page.title: 05Few amenities in Glastonbury
page.content: Discontent amongst the young people of Glastonbury appears largely due to {boredom. }The town of Street, two miles to the South, has a{cinema,}a {theatre,}and{two swimming pools;}but Glastonbury with approximately the same population has none of these facilities. Although it is possible to walk or cycle this distance, the fact that all these amenities are in the next town strikes many of the townspeople (particularly the young) as unfair. The bus service which runs to Street, departs only once in every hour and the last bus frequently departs before the cinema or theatre closes. The cost of the busfare also seems to be astronomically expensive to the locals. The youth clubs cater for those up to sixteen years old, then there is little entertainment apart from visits to Public Houses.
